title: Little Mix stun as they head to post-gig party at Jade Thirlwall's new cocktail bar
text:

Little Mix partied in style at Jade Thirlwall's new cocktail bar as they headed out after a hometown gig.

After the girlband performed at Newcastle's Utilita Arena, Jade and the gang headed to South Shields to hang out in her new venue, Red Door.

She was joined by Perrie Edwards, who also hails from South Shields, and Leigh-Anne Pinnock, although Jesy Nelson didn't join in on the night out.

The girls looked stunning as they put on a leggy display to pose up outside the bar.

Leigh-Anne looked gorgeous in a strappy dress, while Perrie showed off her enviable pins in a black T-shirt dress and orange heels, and stunner Jade posed up in a black skirt and white bralet with a black jacket on top.

(Image: North News & Pictures Ltd nort)

(Image: North News & Pictures Ltd nort)

The girls posed up a storm for photographers before heading into her new late-night cocktail bar, in the town's Ocean Road.

Speaking about her club, Jade said: "I’m proud to come from South Shields. I love my home town and wanted to invest in the local economy. South Shields is a unique place with a lot to offer and I wanted to support that.

"South Shields has always been known for being a great night out - it’s a town with a real party spirit so I thought where better to open Red Door.

(Image: North News & Pictures Ltd nort)

(Image: North News & Pictures Ltd nort)

"I wanted to find a company that would shake things up and bring something different to South Shields. Red Door has bars in Chester and Liverpool and it was clear they would be a really good fit for the venue.

"The main aim is to create an unforgettable experience for everyone who comes to Red Door."

The girls were joined for their celebratory night out by fellow X Factor winner Joe McElderry, who also hails from South Shields.

(Image: North News & Pictures Ltd nort)

(Image: North News & Pictures Ltd nort)

Joe smiled for photographers as she posed up outside in checked trousers and a matching jacket.

The town's resident Geordie Shore star, Sophie Kasaei, was there too.

She looked gorgeous in black trousers and a blazer with a long-sleeved mesh top underneath.

The reality babe posed up on the dancefloor with a drink in her hand.

(Image: Redferns)

Little Mix's support act, boyband New Rules were there too, lining up together outside for a picture.

Footballer Andy Carroll also made an appearance.

The Newcastle United player posed up for pictures outside the venue.
